sentence.Network_en: Amethyst was believed by the Greeks to protect a person from drunkenness.
sentence.Network_cn: 希腊人认为紫水晶可以防止人喝醉。

sentence.Network_en: She pinned a large amethyst brooch to her lapel.
sentence.Network_cn: 她在翻领上别了一枚大大的紫水晶饰针.

sentence.Network_en: On display are earrings, necklaces and bracelets made from jade, amber and amethyst.
sentence.Network_cn: 展出的有用玉石 、 琥珀和紫水晶做的耳环 、 项链和手镯.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : via Old French from Latin amethystus, from Greek amethustos 'not drunken' (because the stone was believed to prevent intoxication)

encyclopedia.content: 简介 YOSHIKI单曲AMETHYST (1993/11/3)(TODT-3130) 所属专辑Eternal Melody (1993/4/21)(TOCT-6994~5) “AMETHYST，我一直觉得是YOSHIKI的神来之作。或许对于古典出身的他，写这样的交响乐并不是一件很困难的事，但他自己也说了，只有作曲，是无论如何努力都没有用的，只能等待灵感。 amethyst，紫水晶。代表灵性、精神、高层次的爱意。象征洁身自好，出淤泥而不染。早在X时期就已经有了这首曲子，当然那时候只有交响乐版本的。因

entry.tran: 紫（水）晶，水碧（有时用于制作珠宝）
entry.def: Amethysts are clear purple stones, sometimes used to make jewellery.

example.ex: The necklace consisted of amethysts set in gold.
example.tran: 这是一条金镶紫水晶项链。

entry.def: Amethyst is used to describe things that are pale purple in colour.

example.ex: ...as the colours changed from green to amethyst.
example.tran: 当颜色从绿色转变成淡紫色

means.word_mean: 1. a transparent purple variety of quartz; used as a gemstone
